basics.name: Bakin Eugene
basics.label: software developer
basics.summary: I'm from Chelyabinsk, Russian Federation. I have a Master degree in Applied Mathematics and Physics from South Ural State University. I tried to continue my career path in theoretical physics, but quickly understood that my passion is more in building things than in theory. So I moved to software engineering. I started with some freelance gigs - trying various things in software development - from creating javascript plugins to working with asterisk. Then I found my first work in web-development in small outsource company "Inventix". Then I switched jobs to work for Rugion - a company which has a number of regional web-portals all over the Russian Federation. My work focuses on both front-end and back-end (PHP, JavaScript). And my desire is to switch completely to front-end development (JavaScript, CSS, HTML).

work.summary: This is a big company that holds many regional sites in Russian Federation
highlights: Built email/sms campaign maker - with tracking all the steps from opening letter to buying something in e-shop
Integrated application with various payment gates (PayEx, WyWallet, MultiMobil, PayPal, 2irect2internet)

work.summary: It is a small outsourcing company. I was working on admin part of marketing web-application for Sweden market. It was used to generate compact e-shops that would be embedded in regular web-sites or shown on mobile phone. I was working with everything related to it - from generating email sending campaign to using various payment gates.
highlights: Built email/sms campaign maker - with tracking all the steps from opening letter to buying something in e-shop
Integrated application with various payment gates (PayEx, WyWallet, MultiMobil, PayPal, 2irect2internet)

work.summary: I was working on a software for computing distribution of stresses in metal targets under severe temperature treatments (radiated using beams of electrons or ions)
highlights: Built NetCDF based db for storing computed data
Refactored codebase to switch compiler and system (from windows to gfortran/linux, from Fortran 70 to fortran 2003)
Built visualisation program based on python/matplotlib
